text: Seeing a working ox, a calf that was just resting and eating was moved by her luck and rejoiced at her own. But a religious feast was held, and as the bull was being led aside, the calf was taken to be sacrificed. And the ox saw it, and smiled, and said, Behold, the calf, thou knowest why thou didst not work: thou wast reserved for the sacrifice. Beware of idleness, for it may conceal evil.
title: El buey y la becerra
author: nan Esopo
